benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Upload the full catalog as XML

covered: Endpoint availability and basic POST flow: background and multiple successful upload scenarios assert 201 and resource creation (TC01-TC05, TC13).
Header validation: required, optional, missing, empty, and extra header cases exercised (TC01-TC07, TC11).
Payload validation: well-formed, malformed, empty, whitespace-only, partial/corrupted XML tests (TC08, TC09, TC18, TC23).
Content-Type rejection: unsupported content-type test present (TC10).
Large payloads and limits: very large payload and boundary tests exist (TC12, TC30).
Security and robustness: malicious content / XXE and partial transmission/network interruption tests (TC17, TC15).
Performance and concurrency baseline: controlled load and concurrency scenarios included (TC19, TC20).
Encoding and special content: unicode, encodings, CDATA/comments covered (TC24, TC28, TC29).
Duplicate/unexpected inputs: duplicate-version, extra query params, and unexpected headers tested (TC25, TC26, TC11).
Regression/compatibility and accessibility: known-bug regression, legacy client compatibility, and assistive-technology accessibility tests included (TC21, TC22, TC31).
gaps: Content-Type acceptance and header presence: no explicit tests for missing Content-Type header or acceptance of alternate but common MIME types (for example application/xml) and charset variants (e.g., text/xml; charset=UTF-8).

Schema-level validation: no test for well-formed but semantically invalid catalog XML (missing required catalog elements or invalid business values) to ensure schema/business validation rejects bad catalogs.
Internal server errors (500): no test simulates DB/transaction failure or internal server error expecting a 500 response and appropriate handling.
Rate limiting / throttling: no tests exercise server throttling or 429 responses under excessive request rates.
Concurrency conflict / idempotency: no deterministic test for race conditions when multiple clients upload the same version concurrently (to assert 409 or defined conflict behavior).

Response contract assertions: tests do not consistently assert produced response Content-Type (text/plain or application/json) and do not validate the response body type is a string as specified by the API.
Location header verification: no tests follow the Location header to GET the created catalog to ensure the returned URL is valid and the resource is accessible and correct.

Duplicate submission in quick succession: beyond version-specific duplicate cases there is no test that posts the exact same payload twice quickly to check duplicate-submission handling and idempotency.
Edge header cases: no tests for excessively long or malformed header values (length limits, illegal characters).
Transfer/encoding edge cases: no tests for chunked transfer encoding, streaming large payloads, or Content-Length edge behaviors.
recommendations: Add explicit Content-Type tests: verify behavior when Content-Type is missing, when using application/xml, and when charset parameters are present (text/xml; charset=UTF-8/UTF-16).
Add schema-validation tests: submit well-formed XML that violates the catalog schema (missing required nodes, invalid numeric ranges, invalid identifiers) and assert 400 with clear error messages.
Simulate internal server error conditions: inject DB or transactional failures to assert 500 responses and that failures do not leave the system in an inconsistent state.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: send a burst of requests to validate configured throttling and expected 429 responses or backoff behavior.
Add concurrency/conflict tests: run two concurrent uploads of the same version to observe deterministic conflict resolution (assert one success and the other 409 or the documented behavior).
Assert response contract: for successful and error responses, verify response Content-Type, ensure the body is a string as per API spec, and validate content (confirmation string/URI).
Validate Location header end-to-end: follow the Location URL in tests to GET the created catalog and verify the catalog content and metadata (including CreatedBy and comments where applicable).
Add duplicate-submission tests: post identical payloads in quick succession and assert the service behavior (no duplicate resources or documented duplicate handling).
Add header boundary tests: validate behavior for very long X-Killbill-CreatedBy values, invalid characters, and header size limits.
Add streaming/transfer tests: exercise chunked uploads and very large payload streaming to validate Content-Length, chunk handling, and partial upload recovery semantics.
